titlestmt.title: PCT 10: Four Cree Resist the Blackfoot
titlestmt.author: Coming-Day

bibl.title: Plains Cree Texts
bibl.series: Publications of the American Ethnological Society, Volume XVI

encodingdesc.p: This electronic document is oriented more toward representing those features that seem most likely to be relevant for grammatical analyses, rather than toward faithfully representing all the information available in the book.

list.item: 2014 06 10; KR; UTF-8, paragraph and sentence numbering, smart-quotes in English translations

body.head: PCT 10 - Four Cree resist the Blackfoot

p.seg: kîtahtawê itah êh-ayâcik , êh-wîkicik nêhiyawak , mâwacihitôwak ê-sipwêhtêcik oskinîkiwak , iyâhciyiniwah êh-ntonawâcik , ê-wîh-kimotamawâcik otêmiyiwah misatimwah , kîspin mâka wâpamâtwâwi , pêyakowicih , ta-nipahâcik ; Once where some Cree lived, the young men assembled to go out looking for Blackfoot, in order to steal their horses from them and, if they saw one alone, to kill him;
êkosi itêyihtamwak . that was their intent.

êkwah kâ-wâpahk , kâ-pimohtêcik , têpakohp tahtwâw êh-nipâcik , êkoyikohk wâpamêwak iyâhciyiniwah itah êh-wîkiyit . So on the next day they set out, and when seven times they had slept on the way, they saw some Blackfoot encamped.
êkosi kâsôhtawêwak ; namoya wâpamikwak . They hid from them; the others did not see them.

êkwah êy-itohtêcik , êh-tipiskâyik , êh-otihtâcik itah êh-wîkiyit , apiwak êkotah , cîkih itah k-âyâyit . Then, at night, when they went there and reached the others' camp, they sat there close to where the others were.
nîso nâpêwak itohtêwak mîkiwâhpihk , misatimwah êh-kimotamawâcik , êh-nipâyit . Two men went to a lodge and stole the horses while the owners slept.

êkosi owîcêwâkaniwâwah êh-mâh-miyâcik , ômisiy itwêwak :
têhtapik ; tapasîtân . Then, when they gave them to their comrades, they said, “Mount; let us flee.”
êkosi tâpwê têhtapiwak , ê-wîh-sipwêhtêcik . Accordingly they mounted to depart.
pakwâtêwak êh-mâyâtisiyit misatimwah . they did not like the horses, because they were ugly.
pakitinêwak ; namôya wîh-tapasîwak . They let them go and would not flee.
tâpwê tapasîwak ôki kâ-têhtapicik . So those who were on horses fled.
kotakak nîso nâpêwak mîn êwakonik namoya tapasîwak . Two other men also did not flee.
nêwiwak êkwah êkâ kâ-tapasîcik . Thus they were four who did not flee.

kiwîh-wîcêtinâwâw , oskinîkîtik , itwêw awa kisêyiniw pêyak ,
mâskôc otinâyêko misatim , êh-itêyimitakok . “I shall go with you, youths,” said one, an old man, “for I think you may perhaps succeed in getting a horse or so.”
êkosi êkwah ôki êkâ kâ-tapasîcik nîso ôskinîkiwak itohtêwak , iyâhciyiniwah itah êh-wîkiyit . Then the two youths who had not fled went to where the Blackfoot were camping.
kêyâpic nipâyiwah . They were still asleep.
otinêwak misatimwah êh-miyosiyit nîsitanaw pêyakosâp . They took twenty-one handsome horses.
êkwah owîcêwâkaniwâwah , nîso itah êh-pêhikocik ôhi kisêyiniwah otihtêwak . Then they went back to where their two companions, one of them the old man, were awaiting them.
miyêw misatimwah ôhô kisêyiniwah êwakôw . The one gave a horse to the old man.
awah oskinîkiw ômisi isiyîhkâsôw : kiyâhkâkiyowêw , kâ-miyât kisêyiniwah êh-miyosiyit misatimwah . The name of the youth was Kiyahkakiyowew, he who gave the old man a fine horse.

êkosih ômisih itwêw awa kisêyiniw :
kitatamihin , wêskinîkiyin . Then the old man spoke thus: “I thank thee, youth.

seg.gloss: It was for this I stayed with thee.”

p.seg: êkos êwakw âwa kisêyiniw omis îsiyihkâsôw : tawipîsin isiyîhkâsôw . The name of this old man was Tawipisin.
hêkwah tapasîtân , itwêw awa kisêyiniw . “Now let us flee,” said the old man.
tâpwê têhtapiwak , êh-tapasîcik , ê-wîh-kîwêcik . Accordingly they mounted and made for home.

ômis îtwêw awah kisêyiniw :
oskinîkîtik , êkâ wiyah pimitisahwâtânik kiwîcêwâkaninawak . Thus spoke the old man: “Young men, let us not go in pursuit of our companions.

seg.gloss: Let us go in a different direction.
Tomorrow the Blackfoot will pursue them.
No doubt they are far on their way by now.
It is us whom the Blackfoot will overtake.
If they pursue us, let us go in a different direction.
The Blackfoot will not see us.”

p.seg: âhag , itwêwak oskinîkiwak . “Very well,” said the young men.
êkosi tapasîwak . So they fled.
êkwah ohpimêh itâmôwak . They fled in a different direction.
tâpwêh êh-wâpahk kiskêyihtamwak iyâhciyiniwak êh-kimotamâhcik otêmiwâwah . As they had foreseen, in the morning the Blackfoot saw that their horses had been stolen from them.

wawêyîwak , êh-âh-awihitocik otêmiwawah , ê-pimitisahwâcik nêhiyawah , êkwah kapê-kîsik êh-pimipayicik , nêhiyawah ê-wîh-kakwêy-atimâcik . They made ready, lending one another horses, and went in pursuit of the Cree, riding all day to overtake them.
piyisk tipiskâw . At last night came.
namoya wâpamêwak nêhiyawah . They had no sight of the Cree.
âhci pikô pimohtêwak , ê-wîh-kakwê-wâpamâcik nêhiyawah . Still they went on, seeking to get sight of the Cree.
êh-wâpahk êkwah mînah êh-sipwêhtêcik , êh-pimitisahwâcik nêhiyawah , kîtahtawê kâ-wâpamâcik ; In the morning, when again they set out in pursuit of the Cree, suddenly they saw them;

itah ê-wîh-mîcisocik nêhiyawak , pêyak mostoswah ê-nipahâcik , êkotah kâ-wâpamâcik iyâhciyiniwak ôhi nêhiyawah . where the Cree were about to eat, having slain a buffalo, there the Blackfoot caught sight of the Cree.
mêkwâc êh-mîcisoyit moskîstawêwak . They attacked them while they were eating.
êkwah ôkih nêhiyawak pasikôwak , êh-otinâcik misatimwah , êh-têhtapicik , êh-tapasîcik . The Cree jumped to their feet, seized the horses, mounted, and fled.
êkwah âtiht nôtinikêwak ; pâh-pâskiswêwak ayâhciyiniwah . Some of them fought; they shot at the Blackfoot.
wiyawâw mînah pâh-paskisokwak iyâhciyiniwah . The Blackfoot, too, kept shooting at them.
piyisk kinwês nôtinitôwak , êh-pimohtêcik . For a long time they fought each other as they went along.
pêyak nipahâw nêhiyaw . One Cree was killed.
êkosi poyowak iyâhciyiniwak , nêhiyawah pêyak ê-nipahâcik . Then the Blackfoot ceased, when they had killed one Cree.
kâ-pôyôcik êkosi kîwêwak ôki ayâhciyiniwak . The Blackfoot ceased fighting and went home.

êkwah ôki ôhpimê kâ-pimohtêcik nêhiyawak , êwakô kisêyiniw aw itah kâ-wîcihiwêt , kâw êkotah itohtêwak , owîcêwâkaniwâwah mêskanaw ê-wîh-kakwê-wâpahtahkik , itah ê-kîh-pimohtêyit . As for those Cree who had gone off in another direction, the party of that old man, they went back to look for the tracks of their comrades.
tâpwê wâpahtamwak itah ê-kîh-pimipayiyit . They saw the place where the others had gone by.

âh , oskinîkîtik , itwêw awa kisêyiniw ,
namoya êko-tahtoh ôhc ihtasiwak ; “Now, young men,” said the old man, “there were not so many of them as this;
osâm mistahi oki misatimwak kâ-pimiskanawêcik , itwêw awah kisêyiniw . too many tracks have the horses made by here,” said the old man.

oskinîkiwak ôkih omis îtêwak :
êko-tahto oma kâ-kîh-otinâcik misatimwah , itêwak ôhô kisêyiniwah . The young men answered him, “This is the number of the horses they have taken,” said they to the old man.
êkos îtwêwak . So they spoke.
âhci pikôw ati-sipwêhtêwak . Again they set out.

namôya wâhyaw êh-ihtâcik , kâ-pê-sâkêwêyit , êh-nakiskawâcik , êh-kîwêyit ow iyâhciyiniwah . They were not far on their way, when they encountered those Blackfoot coming out from behind a hill on their way home.
wâpamikwak êkosih . Thus they were seen by the others.
tapasîwak ôki nêhiyawak . The Cree fled.
môskîstâkwak . The others attacked them.
ê-sakâyik êkota sêskisiwak otêmiwawah kikih . They took refuge with their horses in a wooded place.
sakâhk ayâwak . They stayed in the brush.
wîhkwêskâkwak ayâhciyiniwah . The Blackfoot surrounded them.
wâtihkêwak êkota sakâhk , êkotah awa kisêyiniw êh-wîh-apit wâtihkânihk , êkwah pêyak oskinîkiw . They dug a pit there in the woods, for the old man to stay in, and the one young man.
êkwah nîso ôk ôskinîkiwak namôya wîh-apiwak wâtihkânihk , êkwah êh-pâskisokocik ayâhciyiniwah . The other two young men decided not to stay in the pit when the Blackfoot fired on them.
pêyak ômisi isiyîhkâsôw : kiyâhkâkiyowêw isiyihkâsôw ; êkwah pêyak pâhpâscês isiyihkâsôw . The one's name was Kiyahkakiyowew, the other's Pahpastches.
êwakonik nêhiyawak êh-nôtinikêcik êh-nîsicik . Those were the two Cree who fought.

êwakonik êh-pîhtâsocik pâskisikanah , ôki kâ-nôtinikêcik êh-âpacihtâcik , kâh-tasinahkwâwih kâ-isiwêpinamawâcik ôhi kisêyiniwah , kotak êh-otinahk pâskisikan . they loaded the guns for those who were fighting, the latter tossing the guns, when they had fired them, to the old man, and taking another.
êwakonik ôki oskinîkiwak , kîspin êkâh êh-kostikocik iyâhciyiniwah , êyakoni êh-nipahâcik . These young men, whenever a Blackfoot failed to keep at a cautious distance, him they killed.
ôhô wiyah otêmiwâwah kahkiyaw nipahêyiwah . But the others killed all their horses.
piyisk mihcêt nipahêyiwah iyâhciyiniwah . At last they had killed many Blackfoot.
piyisk kostikwak . The others came to fear them.
kêkâc êh-tipiskâyik , êkoyikohk poyôyiwah ôh iyâhciyiniwah , êh-tapasiyit , êh-sêkihâcik . Almost at nightfall the Blackfoot quit and ran away; they had frightened them.
pêyak pikoh nipahikwak êwakonik ôki . Only one of these men had been slain.
êkwah ê-kîh-tapasiyit , êkwah êh-wâ-wâpamâcik otêmiwâwah . Then when the others had run away and they looked at their horses,

awa kisêyiniw kâ-kîh-miyiht misatimwah , êwako pikoh pimâtisiyiwah , ês êh-kawipitisowit , oskâtiyihk êh-tapakwâtahk pîsâkanâpiy ohci awa misatim . only the horse which had been given to the old man was alive; it had apparently thrown itself down on the ground by getting its foot snagged in the tether. LB on {êh-tapakwâtahk}: This word is probably wrongly recorded; the translation is a guess.
êkos îsi otinêw awa kisêyiniw . Thus the old man took it.
êkosi sipwêhtêwak , êh-kîwêcik ôki nêhiyawak . So the Cree set out for home.
pêyak piko nipahâw nêhiyaw , êh-nêwicik . Only one of the four Cree was slain.
cikêmâ wiyawâw mihcêt nipahêwak yâhciyiniwah . But certainly they had slain many of the Blackfoot.
êwakw ôhi k-ôh-poyôcik , ê-sêkihâcik . They ceased fighting when they had frightened them off.
êkos îsi pimâtisiwak . So they saved their lives.
êkosi êh-wâpahk , kapê-tipisk êh-pimohtêcik , êh-wâpahk , êh-otâkosihk , takosinwak wîkiwâhk ôki nêhiyawak . On the next day, after marching all night, in the evening these Cree reached their camp.
wiya piko awa kisêyiniw pêyak pêsiwêw ôhi misatimwah . Only the old man brought home his horse.
ôki wiyah oskinîkiwak kahkiyaw nipahêyiwah otêmiwâwah yâhciyiniwa . The young men's horses had all been killed by the Blackfoot.
êkosi êkoyikohk âcimowin êwakoh . That is the end of this story.
